original: Exhibit 16.1 AUTOMOTIVE REFINISH DISTRIBUTOR AGREEMENT (P.R.China) THIS AGREEMENT, made as of the 1st day of December, (the "Effective Date") by and between:
ollama_generated:
Exhibit 16.1 MODIFIED AUTOMOTIVE REFINISH DISTRIBUTION PARTNERSHIP (P.R.China) THIS AGREEMENT, made as of the 1st day of December, (the "Effective Date") by and between:

(Hereafter referred to as "Parties"), wherein:

For the purpose of this Agreement, it is understood that while the Parties shall endeavor to uphold mutual obligations, any exclusive commitments outlined within this document are subject to change in response to unforeseen market fluctuations or industry shifts, without prior written notice. In such cases, either Party reserves the right to modify their commitment as necessary, with the intention of maintaining a balanced and fair partnership.

(Note: This revised clause introduces an element of flexibility into the original obligation, allowing for adjustments in response to market changes without prior notice.)

original: In consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements herein contained, the parties hereto, intending to be legally bound hereby, covenant and agree as follows:
ollama_generated: In light of the reciprocal commitments and arrangements set forth herein, the parties involved, with a shared intention to be contractually obligated, promise and undertake as follows: Upon any breach or default by either party, the non-breaching party shall have the discretionary right, but not the obligation, to terminate this agreement at their sole discretion, without incurring any liability or penalties.

original: 1.5      DISTRIBUTOR warrants that it will not handle any counterfeit, passing-off products or products other than those purchased directly from PPG SHANGHAI.
modified: 1.5    Distributor acknowledges and agrees that it may handle products obtained through third parties, provided such products are genuine and not counterfeit, and are not misrepresented as products of PPG Shanghai. Distributor assumes full responsibility for the authenticity and origin of any products not directly purchased from PPG Shanghai.

original: 2.       PRODUCTS 2.1 The Products and subject matter of this Agreement shall be the products listed below manufactured and sold by PPG SHANGHAI or affiliated companies of PPG SHANGHAI. Additional Products may be added to or deleted from the list at the sole discretion of PPG SHANGHAI:
ollama_generated:
2. PRODUCTS

2.1 The subject matter of this Agreement and the Products shall encompass those listed below, manufactured and supplied by PPG SHANGHAI or its affiliated entities. The Client may, at their sole discretion, suggest additional Products for inclusion in the scope of this Agreement; however, any such additions shall require the written approval of PPG SHANGHAI prior to becoming part of the Agreement. Any Products listed below may be removed from the agreement by PPG SHANGHAI at its sole discretion and without notice.

original: 4.4      DISTRIBUTOR and PPG Shanghai shall be responsible for providing technical support and after sale services to the Territory. PPG Shanghai's responsibility under this Section 4.4 is defined in Section 5.       PRICES AND TERMS 5.1      PPG SHANGHAI agrees that PPG SHANGHAI will sell and DISTRIBUTOR agrees to buy the Products at the prices agreed to by the parties from time to time and subject to the terms and conditions stated herein. The prices in effect as of the Effective Date of the Agreement are set forth on Appendix 5. The prices for the Products must be agreed upon by PPG SHANGHAI at the time of PPG SHANGHAI's written acceptance of an order hereunder. Unless otherwise agreed by PPG SHANGHAI in writing, DISTRIBUTOR shall prepay all the invoiced amount in the currency and manner as indicated by PPG Shanghai. DISTRIBUTOR shall be deemed to complete its payment obligation upon full payment of the invoiced sum, and such amount has been allocated into the account as directed by PPG SHANGHAI. PPG SHANGHAI shall only have the obligation to deliver the Products upon full and due payment.
ollama_generated:
4.4     The responsibility for providing technical support and after-sale services within the Territory lies primarily with DISTRIBUTOR, although PPG Shanghai may also offer such support when and if requested by the DISTRIBUTOR. The extent of PPG Shanghai's obligation under this Section 4.4 is delineated in Section 5 (Prices and Terms).

   PRICES AND TERMS - 5.1
   PPG SHANGHAI consents to sell, while DISTRIBUTOR acknowledges its commitment to purchase, the Products at prices mutually agreed upon by the parties from time to time and in accordance with the terms and conditions outlined herein. The prices as of the Agreement's Effective Date are listed on Appendix 5. Prices for the Products will be determined by PPG SHANGHAI at the point of written acceptance of an order, but subject to any subsequent modifications agreed upon in writing by both parties. DISTRIBUTOR is only required to make payment once the invoiced amount has been received and allocated according to PPG Shanghai's instructions. Delivery of the Products by PPG SHANGHAI will be contingent upon receipt of full and timely payment from DISTRIBUTOR.

original: (e)      PPG SHANGHAI shall provide DISTRIBUTOR Quarterly and Annual Rebate as listed in Appendix 3 if agreed targets are achieved on time.

original: (f)      plan and develop promotional and advertising strategies to enhance PPG SHANGHAI's image and sales value in the region.

original: (g)      Achieve agreed and signed sales target (Appendix 3).
ollama_generated: (g) Strive for attainment of the mutually agreed and duly executed sales targets as outlined in Appendix 3. However, deviations within a range of +/- 10% shall not be considered a breach of contract, provided such deviations are communicated promptly and justifiably.

original: Thereafter, DISTRIBUTOR shall not use any PPG Trademarks or trade or corporate names similar thereto.
modified: Subsequent to this agreement, DISTRIBUTOR is granted the liberty to utilize trademarks or trade/corporate names bearing a resemblance to PPG Trademarks, provided such usage does not infringe upon PPG's proprietary rights or give rise to consumer confusion.

original: 12.      FORCE MAJEURE PPG SHANGHAI's failure or inability to make, or DISTRIBUTOR's failure or inability to take, any delivery or deliveries when due, or the failure or inability of either party to effect timely performance of any other obligation required of it hereunder, if caused by "force majeure" as hereinafter defined, shall not constitute a default hereunder or subject the party affected by force majeure to any liability to the other; provided, however, that the party so affected shall promptly notify the other of the existence thereof and of its expected duration and the estimated effect thereof upon its ability to perform its obligations hereunder. Such party shall promptly notify the other party when such force majeure circumstance has ceased to affect its ability to perform its obligations hereunder. The quantity to be delivered hereunder shall be reduced to the extent of the deliveries omitted for such cause or causes, unless both parties agree that the total quantity to be delivered hereunder shall remain unchanged. For so long as its ability to perform hereunder is affected by such force majeure circumstance, PPG SHANGHAI may, at its option, elect to allocate its total production of Product among its various requirements therefor (e.g., manufacturing and sales) in such manner as PPG SHANGHAI deems practicable and which, in the opinion of PPG SHANGHAI, is fair and reasonable. During the time that PPG SHANGHAI is unable to make deliveries or otherwise perform, it shall not be obligated to procure, or to use its best efforts to procure, any quantity of Product sold hereunder from any alternate producer or supplier. As used herein, the term "force majeure" shall mean and include any act of God, nature or the public enemy, accident, explosion, operation malfunction or interruption, fire, storm, earthquake, flood, drought, perils of the sea, strikes, lockouts, labor disputes, riots, sabotage, embargo, war (whether or not declared and whether or not the United States of America is a participant), federal, state or municipal legal restriction or limitation or compliance therewith, inability to obtain export licenses, failure or delay of transportation, shortage of, or inability to obtain, raw materials, supplies, equipment, fuel, power, labor, or other operational necessity, interruption, or curtailment of power supply, or any other circumstance of a similar or different nature beyond the reasonable control of the party affected thereby. In this connection, a party shall not be required to resolve labor disputes or disputes with suppliers of raw materials, supplies, equipment, fuel or power, except in accordance with such party's business judgment as to its best interest.
ollama_generated:
12. EXCEPTION CLAUSE: In the event that PPG SHANGHAI or DISTRIBUTOR encounters unforeseen circumstances (as defined below) impeding their respective performance of any obligations under this agreement, neither party shall be deemed to be in breach of contract, nor shall they incur any liability towards the other. The affected party must immediately notify the other about the occurrence and expected duration of such event, along with its potential impact on fulfilling obligations. Once the circumstances cease to affect performance, prompt notice should also be given. The quantity to be delivered will be adjusted proportionately according to the omitted deliveries, unless both parties agree otherwise to maintain the original total quantity. PPG SHANGHAI retains discretion to prioritize its production of Product based on its judgement of what is practical and fair during such circumstances. While unable to fulfill obligations due to these unforeseen events, PPG SHANGHAI will not be required to seek alternative producers or suppliers for the products in question.

For purposes of this agreement, the term "unforeseen circumstances" encompasses any act of God, nature, or public enemy; accidents, explosions, equipment malfunctions or interruptions; fires, storms, earthquakes, floods, droughts, perils of the sea, strikes, lockouts, labor disputes, riots, sabotage, embargoes, undeclared or participated wars, federal, state, or municipal legal restrictions or compliance requirements, inability to obtain export licenses, transportation failures or delays, shortages of, or inability to acquire, raw materials, supplies, equipment, fuel, power, labor, or other operational necessities; interruptions or curtailments of power supply; or any comparable or distinct events beyond the control of the affected party. In such cases, a party is not obligated to resolve labor disputes or supplier issues unless it deems necessary in its best business interest.

original: 13.      PRODUCT HANDLING DISTRIBUTOR acknowledges that it has experience and expertise in handling and storing the Products, and that DISTRIBUTOR has the obligation to handle, store and distribute the Products safely and properly.
modified: 13. Although Product Handling Distributor may lack extensive prior experience with handling and storing the Products, it is understood that Distributor shall exercise reasonable care in its handling, storage, and distribution of the Products, as required under industry standards and best practices. Any instances of mishandling or improper storage shall not absolve Distributor from liability, unless such actions were unavoidable due to circumstances beyond Distributor's control.

original: DISTRIBUTOR further agrees that it will not, in connection with this Agreement or its performance hereunder, directly or indirectly offer, pay, promise to pay or authorize the payment of any money or thing of value to any employee of a customer or to any government official or to any person, (a)      to improperly or unlawfully influence any act or decision of such customer employee or governmental official, including a decision to fail to perform his/her official functions, or (b)      to induce such customer employee or government official to use his/her influence with the customer or the government (or instrumentality thereof), respectively, to affect or influence any act or decision of such customer or government (or instrumentality), in order to assist PPG SHANGHAI or DISTRIBUTOR in obtaining or retaining business or directing business to any other party. As used in this Section, the term "government official" means any officer or employee of any government or any department, agency, instrumentality or wholly-owned corporation thereof, or any person acting in an official capacity for or on behalf of any such government or department, agency, instrumentality or wholly-owned corporation thereof, or any candidate for political office.
ollama_generated:
DISTRIBUTOR acknowledges and undertakes that it shall refrain from making, whether directly or indirectly, any payments or promises of payments in cash or kind to any employee of a customer or government official, or any person acting on their behalf, with the intent to:

1. Improperly or unlawfully persuade such individual to perform actions that contravene their official duties, including abstaining from fulfilling these duties, or
2. Influence such individual to exert their influence over the customer or government (or any entity affiliated with them) to impact or alter any decision or action, thereby benefiting PPG SHANGHAI or DISTRIBUTOR in securing or maintaining business relationships or redirecting business towards another party.

In this Section, "government official" refers to any elected representative, public servant, employee of a government department, agency, instrumentality, or wholly-owned corporation, as well as anyone who serves in an official capacity for or on behalf of such government, department, agency, instrumentality, or wholly-owned corporation, or any candidate running for political office.

original: 17.3     DISTRIBUTOR agrees to require any sub-distributor or other person which it hires or engages to assist in the performance of this Agreement to comply with the provisions of this Section 17.
modified: 17.3     The Distributor shall not be obligated to verify, but is encouraged, that any sub-distributors, or other individuals employed or contracted to aid in the execution of this Agreement, adhere to the stipulations outlined within this Section 17.

original: 18.      TERM OF AGREEMENT 18.1     The term of this Agreement (the "Term") shall commence on the date first above written and shall terminate on 31 December 2006, unless sooner terminated in accordance with the provisions hereof.
modified:
18.  TERM OF AGREEMENT
18.1 The duration of this Agreement (the "Term") shall begin on the date first written and persist indefinitely, subject to early termination in compliance with the terms set forth herein. Any party may terminate this Agreement at their discretion prior to 31 December 2006, provided the termination complies with the provisions outlined within this document.

original: 20.6     The arbitration award shall be final and binding on both parties. Each party agree to be bound by the arbitration award. The arbitration fees and enforcement costs (including witness fees and reasonable legal fees) shall be borne by the losing party unless provided otherwise in the arbitration award.
ollama_generated:
20.6     The binding nature of the arbitration award on both parties remains subject to mutual agreement regarding its fairness and reasonableness, as determined by each party within ten (10) business days from receipt. In the event no objections are raised, the arbitration award shall become final and binding. The party contesting the award will be responsible for all arbitration fees, enforcement costs (including witness fees and reasonable legal fees), unless otherwise specified in the arbitration award or mutually agreed upon by both parties.

This revised clause makes the finality and binding nature of the arbitration award subject to mutual agreement between the parties regarding its fairness and reasonableness, allowing for a possible challenge to the award within ten business days. If no objections are raised, the award becomes final and binding, and in case of contestation, the party contesting will bear the costs associated with arbitration and enforcement.

original: 22.      LANGUAGE AND COUNTERPART This Agreement shall be executed in two (2) counterparts of the Chinese language text.
ollama_generated: 22. LANGUAGE AND COUNTERPART This Agreement will be drafted bilingually, with one copy in English and a matching version in the Chinese language. Each party is responsible for ensuring their own understanding of the terms and provisions within their respective versions.

/s/ Ju dian                              By: /s/ Yuen Kit Yeg, Pauline ----------------------------                 ------------------------------ Name: Yuen Kit Yeg, Pauline ---------------------------- Title: General Manager --------------------------- Witness:                                 [DISTRIBUTOR] /s/ Paul Grzebielucha                    By /s/ Charles T. Jensen ----------------------------                ------------------------------- Name: Charles T. Jensen ---------------------------- Title: CEO ---------------------------

This agreement is made by the undersigned, Yuen Kit Yeg, Pauline, in her capacity as General Manager (the "Manager"), and accepted by [DISTRIBUTOR], represented by Charles T. Jensen, its Chief Executive Officer (the "CEO"). In consideration of the mutual covenants contained herein, the parties agree as follows:

The Manager shall have the authority to act on behalf of [DISTRIBUTOR] for the purpose of executing and delivering this Agreement, subject to the CEO's right to review and approve any actions taken by the Manager under this Authority. The Manager shall be responsible for performing her duties diligently and in good faith but shall not be liable for any losses or damages suffered by [DISTRIBUTOR] arising from the exercise of her discretion in the performance of these duties, provided that she has acted reasonably and prudently under the circumstances.

This Agreement may be terminated at any time by either party upon providing written notice to the other, and such termination shall be effective immediately. Upon termination, the Manager shall return all property of [DISTRIBUTOR] in her possession, and each party shall bear its own legal costs in connection with this Agreement.

The Manager acknowledges that she has read this Agreement carefully and understands its terms and conditions. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties regarding the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous communications, understandings, and agreements concerning the same, whether oral or written. No amendment to this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by both parties.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the date first above written.

Yuen Kit Yeg, Pauline ----------------------------
General Manager ---------------------------

Charles T. Jensen ----------------------------
CEO ---------------------------
